content: slip next st to the right needle sl the elongated stitch back to the left needle slip the slipped st from right to left needle k2tog -2 st helical knitting at the end of each round pick up the next colour from underneath the colour you just worked with to create a jogless striping do not twist yarns 4/10 mohawk style v0 8 instructions socks are worked top-down beginning with the cuff the pattern is mainly written for a set of 5 dpns bor is in the center back the needles are counted from the bor with 12/15/18 st each cuff cast on 48/60/72 sts with a scrap of at least 3 m / 3 3 yd in a medium or dark yarn with your preferred cast on method and distribute them equally on 4 dpns leaving a tail of about 10 cm / 4 in join for working in the round ktbl1 *ktbl1 p1* repeat 10/13/16 times for a total of 11/14/17 times ktbl1 here is the center front 24/30/36 st done if you use markers place one and sl each round ktbl1 *p1 ktbl1* repeat 10/13/16 times for a total of 11/14/17 times ktbl1 end of round if you use markers place one and sl each round work a second round as set with the same yarn after reaching bor ktbl another st with the 4th needle leave a tail of about 20 cm / 8 in on the outside of the fabric you can wind it once around your hand as a measure cut yarn this is the beginning of the rds with the lighter yarn c2 now you can use scraps from minimum 1 2 m / 50 in attach c2 with a tail of about 20 cm / 8 in and work the next cuff round as it appears stopping where you started this round leave a tail of 20 cm / 8 in cut yarn sl 2 sts back from the 4th needle to the 1st needle there is your beginning of the rds with darker yarn c1 attach c1 with a tail of about 20 cm / 8 in and work the next round of the cuff as it appears the round is finished when every st is done once leave a tail of 20 cm / 8 in cut yarn put the first two sts of the 1st needle onto the 4th needle attach c2 with a tail of about 20 cm / 8 in work the next round starting with the new first st on the first needle leave a tail of 20 cm / 8 in cut yarn go on like this so that the cuff has a length of at least 14 rds plus cast on ending with c1 at the backside of the socks is growing a column of hanging yarns with 2 st inbetween if you look at it from the backside cuff down there is c2 on the left and c1 on the right side leg
